intro: Trichodesma perfoliatum, commonly known as the common trichodesma, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaves that are often perforated or have a perfoliate arrangement. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is often found growing in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural practices.
